thread.title: PS BIEBER - The Sydney Morning Herald
thread.title_full: PS BIEBER - The Sydney Morning Herald

title: PS BIEBER - The Sydney Morning Herald
text:
Justin Bieber's fancy Sydney digs had to be "de-odorised". Photo: Wolter Peeters 
With neighbours complaining about Bieber's reported parties, which didn't end until 3am, it would seem it wasn't just noise pollution or screaming school girls marauding around Mosman's posh streets that had been causing problems. 
"It smelled like a Nimbin boarding house," PS was informed by one source this week as the clean-up was underway. SHARE Share on Twitter TWEET Link Justin Bieber is staying in a luxury mansion in Mosman while he is in town for his Sydney concert. 
PS also understands a very expensive sofa was damaged during the stay with Bieber's management coughing up about $30,000 to cover the cost of repairs and clean up, which is but a drop in the ocean next to Bieber's $300 million fortune. 
The luxury digs were developed by businessman Cameron MacDonald who is currently trying to sell the place. SHARE
